column4: uhm, very strange, like i said, tried booting the livecd but it asks me for a login/password.. why is that? no ubuntu previously installed on the box
Did you try logging in as root?
root/root?
Well probably root/no password
damnit, tried with ubuntu/ubuntu ubuntu/ root/root root/ but can't login, my friend is not using a login/password in windows at all
what else can i do? i don't want to do a fresh install on that box without knowing if all the hw works properly
Are you sure you've got the LiveCD Desktop edition and not server?
yes
and it is a login prompt as opposed to a command prompt?
it's gdm/xdm or whatever ubuntu uses, it says 'User ubuntu will be logged in in 10 seconds" but goes back to GDM again
If you can get to a regular command prompt, what happens when you try to start x? (startx)
w8
You're stuck at the login prompt, right? or is it a ttyl prompt?
no it's GDM.
i know what i'm doing :) it's just weird that it's asking me for a login/passwd on the livecd
some ppl on the ubuntuforums etc are experiencing the same problem
if you google for 'ubuntu 8.04 default username'
I know this is common, actually. We just have never been able to narrow it down to one solution. So you are getting into GDM briefly, which means X IS in fact starting.
yes, it seems to be working like it should except that i can't access X.. don't know what to do then, i can't install ubuntu on my friend box without trying it out first ;)
Well, maybe it would be worth seeing if you can get the server edition working and worry about the X issues later.
just a thought
yep, tomorrow. ;) but it's a little bit weird though.. thank you.
